asset.name: Efgartigimod (VYVGART / VYVGART Hytrulo)
asset.stage: Approved (gMG, CIDP) / Phase 3 (Ocular MG, Myositis, ITP, Sjogren's) / Registrational (Seronegative gMG, Graves')
asset.one_liner: Efgartigimod is the first-in-class FcRn-blocking Fc fragment approved for gMG and CIDP, with $4.2B in 2025 net sales and 6 upcoming Phase 3 readouts across autoimmune indications.

commercial_metrics.prescriber_trend: New prescriber and patient growth continuing
commercial_metrics.mg_position: #1 prescribed biologic — drove 60% growth in overall MG biologics share
commercial_metrics.mg_patient_source: 70% of new patients coming directly from orals (earlier line adoption)

biology.simple_explanation: FcRn is a receptor that rescues IgG antibodies from degradation, keeping their levels high in the blood. By blocking FcRn, efgartigimod accelerates breakdown of pathogenic IgG autoantibodies, reducing the autoimmune attack on the body's tissues.

why_good_target.clinical_validation: VYVGART approved in gMG (AChR+) and CIDP; ~19K patients treated globally; #1 prescribed biologic in MG driving 60% growth in overall MG biologics share

mechanism.how_it_works: Efgartigimod is an engineered Fc fragment that binds FcRn with high affinity, blocking its ability to recycle IgG antibodies, accelerating IgG degradation including pathogenic autoantibodies.
mechanism.differentiation: First-in-class Fc fragment; first and only FcRn blocker approved in MG; available as IV (VYVGART) and SC with hyaluronidase (VYVGART Hytrulo PFS); autoinjector estimated 2027

designations: Approved: AChR-Ab+ gMG (US, EU, China, Canada, Japan)
VYVGART SC PFS approved in US and EU
sBLA for seronegative gMG — FDA Priority Review, PDUFA May 10, 2026
UplighTED TED program discontinued for futility (Dec 2025)
regulatory.planned_pathway: Seronegative gMG approval expected May 2026 → broadest MG label. Ocular MG (ADAPT-OCULUS 1Q26). ITP US submission after ADVANCE-NEXT (4Q26). Myositis (ALKIVIA 3Q26). Sjogren's (UNITY 2H27). Autoinjector launch ~2027.

partnership._note: No co-development partner. Delivery technology partnerships only.

by_dose.engagement: IgG reduction curve shown (slide 21) — efgartigimod achieves cyclical ~60-70% IgG reduction from baseline oscillating over 140-day period; no numeric axis values provided

pharmacology.pk_summary: PK/PD curve on slide 21 shows efgartigimod has cyclical IgG reduction pattern (oscillating between ~-20% and ~-70% from baseline) compared with ARGX-213 which achieves sustained ~-75-80% reduction. No numeric PK values provided.

trials.name: ADAPT Oculus
trials.prior_evidence: ADAPT ocular domain data and real-world case reports

trials.name: ALKIVIA
trials.prior_evidence: ALKIVIA PoC: significant improvement in muscle strength (TIS) in Phase 2

trials.name: ADVANCE NEXT
trials.prior_evidence: ADVANCE Phase 3 IV and real world data from Japan

trials.name: UNITY
trials.prior_evidence: RHO and DAHLIAS PoC: reductions in systemic disease activity in Phase 2

trials.name: UplighTED Phase 3 (TED) — DISCONTINUED
trials.design: Two parallel Phase 3 randomized, double-masked, placebo-controlled, multicenter studies. 2:1 randomization (efgartigimod PH20 SC vs placebo PH20 SC). N=123 per study. Adults with active, moderate-to-severe TED associated with Graves' disease or Hashimoto's thyroiditis.
trials.enrollment: 123 per study (246 total across two studies)

primary_endpoint.name: Proptosis responders at Week 24
primary_endpoint.definition: Percentage of participants who were proptosis responders at Week 24
primary_endpoint.result: FAILED — IDMC recommended stopping for futility after pre-specified interim analysis. Treatment unlikely to meet primary endpoint.

secondary_endpoints.name: Change in proptosis measurement from baseline to Week 24
Change in GO-QoL total score from baseline to Week 24
Percentage with diplopia resolution at Week 24

safety.summary: Favorable safety and tolerability profile. No new safety signals identified.

trials.name: ADAPT-SERON (Seronegative gMG)
trials.status: Completed — positive. sBLA accepted by FDA with Priority Review. PDUFA May 10, 2026.
trials.design: Randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multi-center. Part A: 1:1 randomization to 4 weekly IV infusions of efgartigimod or placebo, 5-week follow-up. Part B: open-label extension with fixed 2 cycles then flexible dosing based on clinical status. Sites across North America, Europe, China, Middle East.
trials.enrollment: 119 (AChR-Ab seronegative gMG: MuSK+, LRP4+, and triple seronegative subtypes)
trials.inclusion: Confirmed MG diagnosis by independent expert panel. MG-ADL total score >= 5. Stable dose of >= 1 gMG treatment (AChEIs, corticosteroids, or nonsteroidal ISTs). AChR-Ab seronegative (MuSK+, LRP4+, or triple seronegative).

primary_endpoint.name: MG-ADL total score change from baseline to Day 29 (Part A)
primary_endpoint.definition: MG-ADL is a validated measure evaluating functional impact on daily activities: speaking, chewing, swallowing, breathing, limb strength
primary_endpoint.result: MET — statistically significant improvement (p=0.0068). Mean improvement of 3.35 points in MG-ADL total score at Week 4 (clinically meaningful).

secondary_endpoints.name: QMG score
secondary_endpoints.result: Improvements observed across subsequent treatment cycles in overall population and all subgroups

subgroup_analyses.result: Improvements in MG-ADL and QMG observed
Improvements in MG-ADL and QMG observed. No prior approved treatments for this subtype.
Improvements in MG-ADL and QMG observed. Historically excluded from studies. Higher disease burden and unmet need. No prior approved treatments.

safety.summary: Well-tolerated. Safety profile consistent with established VYVGART profile in AChR-Ab seropositive gMG and other indications. No new safety concerns identified.

de_risking_context.ocular_mg: Supported by ADAPT ocular domain data + real-world case reports. Novel MGII primary endpoint.
de_risking_context.myositis: ALKIVIA supported by Phase 2 showing significant improvement in muscle strength (TIS). Heterogeneous disease with TIS composite primary endpoint.
de_risking_context.itp: Supported by ADVANCE Phase 3 IV data + real-world data from Japan. Cumulative platelet count primary endpoint. Targets difficult-to-treat patients.
de_risking_context.mmn: EMPASSION supported by Phase 2 proof of concept (ARDA study showed sustained improved grip strength). Head-to-head vs IVIg.
de_risking_context.sjogrens: Supported by RHO and DAHLIAS Phase 2 proof of concept showing reductions in systemic disease activity. Challenging primary endpoint.

differentiation_claims.claim: #1 prescribed biologic in MG, driving 60% growth in overall MG biologics share
differentiation_claims.caveat: Based on argenx market research as of 4Q 2025

differentiation_claims.claim: First and only development program in Ocular MG
70% of new MG patients coming directly from orals (earlier line adoption)

competitive_landscape._note: No specific competitor drugs named in this presentation

market_opportunity.tam: gMG: 60K US patients by 2030 (17K at launch); CIDP: 42K diagnosed (12K at launch); ITP: significant Japan market; Myositis, Sjogren's, Ocular MG, seronegative gMG all expansion
market_opportunity.patient_population: ~19,000 patients on VYVGART globally (Jan 2026). 15+ severe autoimmune diseases being studied.
market_opportunity.peak_sales_estimate: UBS estimates $6.1B VYVGART sales in FY2026 ($4.6B MG + $1.5B CIDP). William Blair modeled $550M peak TED (now removed).
market_opportunity.unmet_need: 70% of new MG patients coming directly from orals (earlier treatment paradigm adoption). 12,000 CIDP patients remain inadequately controlled on SOC in US.

catalysts.what_to_watch: FDA Priority Review. ADAPT-SERON met primary (p=0.0068, MG-ADL -3.35pts). If approved: broadest MG label, adds ~20% of gMG population (MuSK+, LRP4+, triple seronegative). First-ever treatment for LRP4+ and triple seronegative patients. Launch expected by end 2026.
catalysts.bull_scenario: Approval expands TAM by ~11K US patients. No competition in seronegative space. Cements VYVGART as definitive MG treatment across all subtypes.
catalysts.bear_scenario: Unexpected FDA concerns or CRL, though unlikely given Priority Review and clean data.

catalysts.what_to_watch: MGII novel primary endpoint; first and only development in Ocular MG
catalysts.bull_scenario: Positive data adds ~7K patients to US addressable market
catalysts.bear_scenario: Novel endpoint may not capture clinically meaningful benefit

catalysts.what_to_watch: Broadest MG label (MuSK+, LRP4+, triple seronegative)
catalysts.bull_scenario: Adds ~11K seronegative patients to US addressable market
catalysts.bear_scenario: Regulatory delays or additional data requirements

catalysts.bull_scenario: Opens rheumatology market with no targeted therapies
catalysts.bear_scenario: Disease heterogeneity may lead to mixed results

catalysts.what_to_watch: Cumulative platelet count in difficult-to-treat patients
catalysts.bear_scenario: Difficult-to-treat population may limit effect size

catalysts.bull_scenario: Opens largest indication by patient population
catalysts.bear_scenario: Historically difficult endpoint in Sjogren's trials

catalysts.event: UplighTED Phase 3 TED — DISCONTINUED for futility
catalysts.what_to_watch: IDMC stopped trials at interim for futility. Proptosis endpoint not met. Removes ~$550M peak sales. Data at future meeting.
catalysts.bear_scenario: Signals FcRn mechanism may not work in all IgG-mediated diseases; raises questions about other expansion indications

catalysts.event: ADAPT-Forward combination study (efgartigimod + empasiprubart) in AChR+ gMG
catalysts.what_to_watch: First combination study; could show deeper efficacy and differentiate from single-agent FcRn competitors

key_risks: Novel/composite primary endpoints across multiple Phase 3 trials
ITP trial in difficult-to-treat patients may limit generalizability
Rheumatology commercial expansion requires new prescriber base

bull_case.thesis: Market-leading franchise with $4.2B revenue and 90% YoY growth
Label expansion to 60K US addressable MG patients by 2030

bear_case.thesis: Novel Phase 3 endpoints create binary risk across 4 readouts in 2026
bear_case.evidence: MGII, TIS, cumulative platelet, challenging endpoint (slide 26)

bear_case.thesis: Rheumatology expansion requires new commercial infrastructure

key_debates.question: Will the MGII novel primary endpoint succeed in Ocular MG?
key_debates.bull_view: ADAPT ocular domain data and real-world case reports support endpoint
